newsitem.title: COSTA RICA: Tourism takes dive in Costa Rica after kidnaps.
newsitem.headline: Tourism takes dive in Costa Rica after kidnaps.

text.p: Costa Rica's tourism industry has suffered badly since the kidnapping of two European tourists earlier this year, a top official said on Wednesday.

"Tourism has notched up its lowest increase in the last five years, around two percent, very far from the average 17 percent rate for the last five years," Tourism Minister Carlos Roesch told reporters.
He said the abduction of two European women by former guerrillas on New Year's Day had spooked potential visitors, who had previously flocked to Costa Rica's rain forests and beaches.

The two women were released in March after a $200,000 ransom was paid. Photographs have since been released showing one of them, 24-year-old German Nicola Fleuchaus, kissing the alleged leader of her captors.
The official said Mexico's peso devaluation in December 1994 had also lured tourists to comparatively cheaper Mexican resorts.
